title: What Are the Ideal Circumstances for Developing Magnetic Sensitivity?
first_phrase: This text is about the sensitivity of magnetic subjects and the circumstances that can affect it. The previous tokens discuss how the second session could find the subject in a more favorable physical or emotional state, which can enhance the development of magnetic sensitivity. Some of the circumstances that can promote this sensitivity are the moral impression the magnetizer has on the public and some physiological factors such as excessive intellectual work, insomnia, fasting, and sexual excess. The text also mentions that young people between the ages of 15 and 25 who enjoy physical activities such as horse riding, fencing, or canoeing are the most suitable subjects.
content: Malgré une certaine ressemblance avec les affections nerveuses, il est acquis désormais que la sensibilité magnétique n’est pas du tout synonyme de nervosité et qu’elle n’a même aucune relation avec l’hystérie. Les observations minutieuses de magnétiseurs consciencieux — observations contrôlées et corroborées ensuite par les plus savants docteurs, — ont prouvé que beaucoup d’hystériques sont insensibles à la fascination. C’est, au contraire, chez les jeunes gens de 15 à 25 ans que se rencontrent les meilleurs sujets, surtout si on les choisit parmi ceux s’adonnant aux exercices corporels, tels que l’équitation, l’escrime, le canotage, etc., passe-temps qui sont d’ordinaire l’apanage de personnes bien portantes et appartenant aux classes dirigeantes.
last_phrase: In conclusion, we can state that magnetic sensitivity is not synonymous with nervous disorders or hysteria. Rather, it is found in healthy individuals, mainly among young people aged 15 to 25 who engage in physical activities such as horseback riding, fencing, and rowing, indicating that being susceptible to fascination is not related to any sort of illness. These observations were made by conscientious magnetizers and confirmed by eminent doctors. It is essential to understand the nature of magnetic susceptibility and to promote its study to benefit individuals from all walks of life.
